alert.note: Alert for Harrison; Marion; Smith; Upshur (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 05 at 1:58AM CDT until further notice by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Texas, including the following counties, Cass, Gregg, Harrison, Marion, Smith and Upshur. * WHEN...Until 500 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 158 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Longview, Marshall, Kilgore, White Oak, Gladewater, Hallsville, Waskom, Jefferson, Clarksville City, East Mountain, Harleton, Woodlawn, Berea, Karnack, Lodi, Diana, Smithland, Kildare, McLeod and Liberty City. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
